node.title: 'The maths does not add up': NT hospital boss warns staff of bed shortages as COVID outbreak worsens
node.alt: The front of a hospital building featuring signs saying "emergency" and "main entry".
node.description: In a scathing letter to staff, the executive director of the NT's largest hospital has announced all non-urgent surgeries this week will be postponed and visitors banned from the facilities.
node.content:
["Royal Darwin Hospital is bracing for the impact of the Top End's growing coronavirus outbreak, with a letter to staff warning patients will need to be discharged to cope with extra COVID cases.", "Chief Minister Michael Gunner today flagged concerns the virus has \"seeded and moved\"\u00a0beyond the locked-down Katherine region where nine new cases were recorded today.", "The outbreak comes a week after the government released NT-specific modelling showing\u00a0the Territory's health system could handle 30-100 COVID-19 cases a day.", "But so far this year, without a COVID-19 outbreak, the NT's largest medical facility Royal Darwin Hospital (RDH)\u00a0has been forced to call four code yellow overcrowding emergencies.", "In an all-staff email seen by the ABC, the hospitals'\u00a0executive director said\u00a030 COVID beds across RDH and Palmerston Regional Hospital were needed \"at a conservative minimum\".", "\"We have an ED and a hospital which have been well over 100 per cent capacity for months and that needs to change,\" Dr Didier Palmer said.", "\"We have seven extra mental\u00a0health beds [coming] before Christmas and about 10 - 15 residential care beds available in the next few weeks.\u00a0", "\"The maths does not add up without additional discharges, which of course need to be medically safe.\"", "", "
Dr Palmer, middle, issued an all-staff COVID-19 update today.(ABC News)
", "So far, only one of the 11 cases in the current outbreak has required hospitalisation.", "Dr Palmer\u00a0warned staff that health workers \"expect more [cases] to come in both Katherine and Robinson River and perhaps in other areas.\"", "\"The situation remains fluid and there are many unknowns which will only become clearer in the next few days,\" he wrote.", "NT Health Minister Natasha Fyles told ABC Radio Darwin the measures were to free up beds and staff in case the outbreak grew.", "\"It's important that people know emergency and category 1 [surgeries] will continue,\" she said.", "Ms Fyles also urged people to get vaccinated.", "\"Make no mistake, coronavirus will have a huge burden on our hospital acute setting particularly when we have unvaccinated people,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"If we have vaccinated people they will have a mild illness in most cases and won't need to have a hospital bed, but if we have large numbers of the community become infected that do not have that vaccination it will put enormous pressures on our hospital system.\"", "", "
No visitors will be allowed at RDH, except in\u00a0special circumstances.(ABC News: Che Chorley)
", "Dr Palmer's letter said a \"tier 3 response\" had been activated at both hospitals yesterday, meaning no visitors, volunteers or staff will be\u00a0allowed on site\u00a0(with exemptions in place for carers, a support person for birthing women and palliative care).", "Patients who have\u00a0been to Katherine or Robinson River from Sunday, November 7, will\u00a0need to be isolated and tested for COVID-19.", "Staff who have travelled to either township will\u00a0also need to isolate and return a negative test before returning to work.\u00a0", "Staff will also need to wear surgical masks and eye protection in all clinical areas and maintain social distancing and hand hygiene.\u00a0", "And for patients, the letter explained that categories 2\u00a0and 3\u00a0surgeries\u00a0will be deferred across both facilities\u00a0\"for this week\".", "Appointments for outpatients, where possible, will be held over Telehealth or the phone.", "NT\u00a0Health confirmed that all\u00a0affected patients had already been contacted."]
